intro: Pyrrhocactus dubius, commonly known as the red-spined cactus, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its spiny, segmented stems that are typically reddish in color. The plant produces yellow flowers during the summer months, which are borne on short, erect pedicels. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
